Understanding the basics of microblading

Microblading is basically cosmetic tattooing. However, it’s quite different from traditional tattoos because the esthetician uses a blade-shaped tool with rows of microneedles instead of a tattoo gun. This tool creates hair-like strokes along the brows while adding pigment to the skin.

The results are a realistic-looking brow that won’t wash off for a long time (typically a year or more). Since they only last for a long time, microblading tattoos are only semi-permanent, with an easy and almost painless healing process.

However, not every female consumer is a great candidate for microblading. So, sellers must understand their target market, as skin type helps determine if a client is suitable for this cosmetic procedure or not.

For instance, if they have keratosis pilaris on their forehead or frequently deal with cystic acne or breakouts around the brow area, then such consumers can’t enjoy microblading.

Note: Other conditions like sensitive skin, allergy-prone consumers, and pregnant or breastfeeding clients may also fall short of being eligible for microblading procedures.

What will the market be like in 2024?

Experts predict theglobal microblading marketwill reach US $4.2 billion by 2025, moving from US $2.4 billion in 2019 at a 10.8% compound annual growth rate (CAGR). The market’s growth drivers include the rising awareness of microblading benefits and the increasing popularity of cosmetic procedures among young women.

Although the microblading market is in its early development stages, the procedure has enjoyed a popularity boost as more women seek easy ways to achieve the perfect brows. The market is also highly fragmented, with many small-scale players dominating the market (the top 10 players account for less than 30% of the overall market).

Research also suggests Asia-Pacific will register the fastest CAGR over the forecast period. Experts expect the North American microblading market to grow at an impressive rate during the forecast period.

5 necessary tools estheticians need in a microblading kit

1. Microblading pigment

While traditional tattoos use concentrated inks, microblading rolls with smaller pigment particles create a soft, subtle, semi-permanent look.Microblading pigmentscan generally be categorized as either organic or inorganic.

Organicmicroblading pigmentsare usually fruit- or vegetable-based, with many giving them the nickname “lake pigments.” They offer rich brow colors and brighter effects that eliminate a dull, faded look. Organic pigments are also oil-dispersible, meaning the colors blend more naturally with the client’s skin and have little to no clumping.

On the other hand, inorganic pigments consist of iron oxide, preservatives, perfumes, and other additives. While it’s more affordable than organic ink, it has a higher risk of causing reactions or permanent damage.

Inorganic pigmentsare lighter than organic ones, offering less intense colors. While they provide a non-transparent solid color, it can change over time due to the high iron content (some consumers may end up with “pink brows”).

2. Microblading blades

Many people love microblading because it’s customizable.Microblading bladesare one of the tools that bring this customizability to reality. Since everyone has unique skin thickness and features, it makes sense that different blades exist for various clients.

But first, what aremicroblading blades? They’re one of the primary tools, consisting of small, sharp needles that make the frame and form of a blade. Depending on the type of microblade, the needles can come in different shapes, one or more rows, or with narrow or wide spacings.

3. Pigment mixer machine

While regular pigments (like black) work for most situations, some clients may want custom shades for their brows. That’s wherepigment mixer machinescome in. They’re the perfect tool to help estheticians mix various pigments to get their clients’ desired color.

The best part is thatpigment mixer machinesare easy to use, meaning consumers can easily create a wide range of custom colors without any hassle. These tools ensure estheticians get a nicely blended, homogenous pigment mix whenever they need to make a custom shade.

4. Mapping tools

Microblading needs some craftsmanship to make the perfect look, making mapping a crucial part of the process. And consumers will need the perfect tool to help them map theideal brow shapefor their clients.

Thankfully, businesses can offervarious toolsfor mapping. However, some may be more complex, so keep the target consumer in mind before stocking up.

Whilecalipersare perfect for beginners and novice microblading artists, compasses will do more heavy lifting once they master the tool.

5. Marking tools

Mapping toolsmay help get the shape, but it’ll mean nothing if artists can mark them. That’s why they’ll need marking tools to help draw the ideal brow shape before the procedure.

Marking tools are an absolute must-have because they visualize the shape of the client’s future brows. Some artists prefer using pencils as theirmarking tool, while others opt for markers—none is more effective than the other, so it depends more on preference.

However, ensure the marking tool has enough precision and leaves long-lasting marks without smudges.

Leverage these tools

Microblading is a great way to enjoy a semi-permanent brow job for years without needing pesky beauty routines. However, microblading is not a DIY process. Hence, businesses must avoid labeling their offers for at-home use.

The target audience should be licensed professionals with the necessary certificates to carry out these procedures. Estheticians must have the right equipment before starting a microblading business, and sellers can profit from that need.

Remove-it-all Cleanser

Consumers are becoming increasingly tired of double-cleaning their faces after a long day at work. Not only do they have to remove their makeup, but they also have to wash their face again with a separate face wash. This can be a time-consuming and frustrating process, especially for those who are short on time. Consumers will seek products that skip the double cleanse but still deliver the same benefits.

This saves time and helps prevent irritation and clogged pores that can occur when using separate products. Other examples are the UK Gen X brand Skin Rocks and the US Gen Z brand Youthforia. They have both launched cleansers that claim to remove make-up, SPF, and daily impurities without stripping the skin while supporting the skin barrier, meeting the demand for streamlined routines across generations

These hybrid cleansers cater to the growing trend of multifunctional beauty products while prioritizing skin health. US brand U-Beauty is at the forefront of this movement with its innovative The MANTLE Skin Conditioning Wash. This oil balm effectively removes impurities, and then transforms into a cleansing milk that supports the skin’s natural acid mantle and optimal pH levels, all while promoting healthy skin.

The popularity of double cleansers is expected to continue growing as consumers become more interested in simplifying their skincare routines and saving time in the process. As a result, beauty brands will likely continue to innovate and develop new products that combine multiple functions into one convenient formula.

Skin Health Considered

US brand Strip’s “skincare-grade” The Caviar Jelly Makeup Remover is a prime example, featuring biphasic, microfluidic technology with clinically proven anti-aging benefits.

Targeted, active ingredient-rich cleansers are becoming increasingly popular for those with sensitive skin. UK medicinal skincare brand Acnecide’s Face Wash Spot Treatment is a prime example, using powerful ingredients in a targeted manner. To effectively address individual concerns, cleansers must be designed with life stage and hormonal changes in mind. US-based Womaness’ Clean Slate cleanser, for instance, is tailored to sensitive, dry, and irritated skin commonly associated with menopause.

Ingredients will play a starring role in the world of cleansers. UK brand The Inkey List is an excellent example, with its Hyaluronic Acid Cleanser for dry skin, Fulvic Acid cleanser for hyperpigmentation, and Salicylic Acid Cleanser for breakouts.

By tailoring formulations to specific concerns and emphasizing the strength of key ingredients, brands can create a loyal following amongst intellectual consumers. The time is ripe for cleansers that offer targeted solutions rather than a one-size-fits-all approach.

Gentle Giants: Embracing the Microbiome-Friendly Cleansing Wave

Cleansing is shifting towards gentle, microbiome-friendly products that work with the skin’s barrier rather than against it. By catering to the emotional and psychological aspects of skincare, brands can create products that not only cleanse and soothe the skin but also promote overall well-being and self-care. As the demand for gentle, microbiome-friendly cleansers continues to grow, it’s clear that the future of skincare is all about working with the skin’s barrier rather than against it.

Sunscreen Savvy Mastering the Art of SPF Removal”

As the convenience of wash-on sunscreens becomes more apparent, this format is likely to gain popularity. Rather than reapplying sunscreen throughout the day, consumers can simply wash it off with a cleanser, streamlining their skincare routine and reducing the risk of irritation. This white space opportunity presents a chance for brands to innovate and differentiate themselves in the crowded suncare market.

Conclusion

As we’ve explored the cutting-edge skincare cleansing trends, it’s clear that the industry is undergoing a transformative shift towards more thoughtful, inclusive, and scientifically advanced solutions. Brands are not only responding to the immediate needs of consumers but are also anticipating the nuanced demands of future skincare regimes. The move towards hybrid cleansers, personalized cleanser wardrobes, microbiome-friendly products, and SPF-specific formulations represents a broader trend of holistic health, environmental consciousness, and a desire for simplicity without sacrificing quality. As consumers continue to seek out products that offer multiple benefits, cater to specific concerns, and support the overall health of their skin, the beauty industry is poised to innovate and evolve in exciting ways. This is a thrilling time for skincare enthusiasts and a pivotal moment for brands to make a meaningful impact on our daily lives and well-being. The future of skincare is bright, and it promises a landscape where health, efficacy, and convenience converge in harmony.

But these products are more than just a tool to secure fake lashes to natural ones; using the wrongeyelash gluecan cause major headaches for users, including allergic reactions, skin outbreaks, or losing their natural lashes.

Table of ContentsAn overview of the eyelash glue marketMajor factors to consider when purchasing eyelash extension gluesSummary

An overview of the eyelash glue market

According to research, theglobal eyelash glue marketwas worth USD306.4 million in 2022 and is expected to grow to USD433.09 million in 2030 at a 5.94% CAGR.

Theeyelash gluemarket’s current outlook remains positive thanks to the increasing demand for false lashes, with the rising popularity of beauty trends such as dramatic eye makeup looks and voluminous lashes further driving demand. Celebrity and influencer endorsements on social media are adding to these crazes.

Asia Pacific and North America are the top emerging regional markets for eyelash glues, presenting lucrative opportunities for businesses to tap into.

Major factors to consider when purchasing eyelash extension glues

Lashing speed

Lashing speed is defined by how fast a glue cures and adheres, making it one of the most important factors when stocking up onlash glues. The products a business chooses to offer must appropriately reflect their target consumers’ needs.

For example, beginners requirelash gluesthat dry slower so as to give them more time to secure their extensions. Likewise, fast-drying glues are more appropriate for experienced false eyelash users.

Glue quality

Buyers must also be aware of eyelash glue’s potential fumes, making working with them uncomfortable for the user and their potential clients.

Gluefumes can cause irritation for those with sensitive eyes. For this reason, businesses must prioritize eyelash glues with the lowest fumes possible.

Therefore, it’s essential that retailers check aneyelash glue’spotential fume levels via the product’s labels, with some manufacturers advertising their glues as “low fume” or “fume-free.”

Next, check the ingredients to verify the manufacturer’s claim; while most eyelash glues will contain cyanoacrylate (the ingredient responsible for adhesive properties), this is also the main culprit behind fumes. For this reason, it’s best to opt forglueswith a lower cyanoacrylate content or glues containing acrylate copolymers or methacrylate, alternatives to cyanoacrylate.

Desired effect

Choosing the perfect lashextension gluealso involves considering color and finish, which can greatly impact the final look and consumer satisfaction.

Consumers aiming for a subtle, natural look will tend to prefergluesthat dry clear. Clear glues seamlessly blend with natural lashes, ensuring discreet applications that enhance length and volume without drawing attention to the adhesive.

Conversely, consumers looking for a dramatic effect may look for black lash adhesives, especially for volume and mega-volume applications. Dark finishes create a striking lash line and a more pronounced and defined look.

Black lash gluesalso complement bold makeup styles, catering to those who appreciate glamorous and head-turning looks.

Usage environment

Eachlash extension gluehas specific optimal conditions when it comes to humidity and temperature. As a general guideline, glues with quicker drying times are more suited to high-humidity conditions, while slower-drying glues are better for lower-humidity environments.

But, in general, most lash glues will perform optimally in temperatures slightly above the standard room temperature. However, when humidity exceeds the optimal level (around 60%), the cyanoacrylate in theglueis activated due to the excess moisture in the air, causing thelash adhesivesto cure and dry at an accelerated rate compared to regular room conditions. The opposite occurs when the room’s humidity falls below optimal levels (lower than 45%).

Glue viscosity

Although humidity plays a big part inlash glueperformance, extremely hot or cold climates can also affect the adhesive’s viscosity. Since lash adhesives are liquid, changes in temperature matter.

Generally speaking,lash gluesbecome thicker in colder temperatures, leading to increased viscosity and a prolonged drying time. Conversely, higher temperatures make the glue more liquid, speeding up drying.

Experts recommend opting forlash glueswith the best performance in room temperatures between 22 to 26oC (70 to 80oF). This helps lash techs create a controlled environment for perfect viscosity and consistent, efficient drying times.

Summary

Eyelash glues are a crucial addition to any lash extension kit, and the key to keeping false eyelashes in place for long periods.

But before jumping into the market, sellers must consider their target consumers’ lashing speed, likely lashing environment, desired effect, the adhesive’s quality, and glue viscosity before stocking up.

title: What To Know Before Investing in IPL Beauty Devices - Alibaba.com Reads Keywords: Aesthetic Medicine, Beauty, IPL Machine, New Arrivals, Review Analysis

IPL beauty devices took the world by storm for offering the most effortless way to remove peskyhairs. However, their popularity and unbelievable results pushed several manufacturers to flood the market with thousands of devices.

Unfortunately, not all IPL devices offer the same functions and appearances, complicating the buying process even more. So, if retailers want to provide consumers with the best IPL device experience, they must put energy into choosing the right ones.

This article has made the process easier by highlighting everything sellers should remember while purchasing IPL devices.

Table of ContentsOverview of the global IPL hair removal device marketWhat are the benefits of IPL beauty procedures?Everything to consider before investing in IPL beauty devicesFinal words

Overview of the global IPL hair removal device market

Experts say theglobal IPL hair removal devicemarket touched US $351 million in 2022. Now, forecasts suggest the market’s value will reach US $528.6 million by FY 2028 at a 7.1% compound annual growth rate (CAGR).

The increasing availability of high-tech products, rising disposable income, boosted aesthetic awareness, and increased demand for personal care products are driving market growth.

Here are some other relevant statistics:

What are the benefits of IPL beauty procedures?

IPL hair removal devicesuse light spectrums to target dark pigments of unwanted hair, destroying them at the root. Unlike other hair removal methods (like waxing and epilating), IPL procedures are pain-free, although the treated area may feel a bit tender and look reddish.

In addition,IPL beauty proceduresare one of the safest ways to get long-lasting hair removal results. They are quicker, more convenient, and more permanent than shaving sticks or wax, even on sensitive areas.

Everything to consider before investing in IPL beauty devices

The consumer’s requirements

Before stocking up onhair removal devices, retailers must know what they would do for their target consumers—or if the devices would work for them. Check out some conditions consumers prioritize when purchasing IPL beauty devices.

Usually,IPL devicessend their energy into the unwanted hair’s pigment. These devices are super effective on dark hair, including brown, black, and dark blonde. However, they won’t work properly for consumers with lighter hair colors.

To combat this, some manufacturers equip their devices with an IPL and radio frequency technology combination, allowing lighter hair colors to enjoy the benefits of IPL hair removal.

Skin type is another critical prerequisite for consumers. IPL light targets pigments, so it will also attack the skin if there’s no noticeable difference between it and the hair.

For this reason,IPL devicesare recommended for consumers with lighter skin tones, like ivory, fair, and light brown—especially if they have enough contrast between their hair and skin.

Darker-skinned consumers are not left out. Some IPL devices can work for them without any side effects—but only if manufacturers combine them with other technologies like radio frequencies.

Will the target consumer travel often? If yes, choosing devices that are easy to carry on trips is necessary. Focus on the accessories, packing case, size, and weight of the prospective device.

Not allIPL hair removal deviceswill work on the same body areas. Some are perfect for the face and body, while others are more suited for sensitive or intimate areas.

Design and window size

Another thing to keep in mind is the device’s shape.IPL devicesusually feature gun-shaped designs that fit into the user’s palms. So, businesses must prioritize models offering the best grip.

However, if consumers want to reach tricky areas easily, they will prefer IPL devices with curved wand-shaped designs. Lastly, hair removal devices with straight-want slim designs are the easiest to hold, meaning consumers can use them all over their body without tiring their hands.

In addition,the device’swindow size should be large enough to handle large areas (like legs) quickly and smaller portions (like lips) efficiently. In other words, they must offer the sweet spot—not too big or too small.

Power supply

IPL devicescan come with rechargeable batteries or a main power supply. Rechargeable models offer more freedom, as cords won’t restrict movement. Nevertheless, sellers must factor in the charging time and battery duration to provide the best experience.

Likewise, cordedIPL devicesoffer plug-and-play services but are limited by their cord length. So, consumers may find reaching areas not within the cord’s reach challenging.

Energy output

Higher energy output translates to greater device efficiency. But despite the obvious advantage, great energy outputs also increase the chances of redness and skin irritation.

But don’t worry. MostIPL devicesonly output 6–10 J/cm2 of energy, safe enough to kill hair without side effects. But if target consumers can handle the heat, businesses can offer devices up to 20 J/cm2.

Number of flashes/lifespan

The number of flashesIPL devicescan deliver determines their lifespan. Since consumers will spend a good amount on these devices, they’ll want something that will last for years.

IPL devices offering 250,000 flashes may last up to 20 years on average, which is good enough for most people. But devices with 1 million flashes may last a lifetime without losing effectiveness.

Pain relief features

Although IPL treatments are mostly pain-free, some consumers may experience a rubber band snapping sensation during the procedure, creating a stinging sensation.

If target consumers are worried about this potential side effect, retailers can opt forIPL deviceswith ice-cooling technology. This feature will help prevent even the smallest pain, giving consumers the best experience possible.

Intensity levels

Different consumers require various energy levels. In truth, even a single user needs multiple intensity levels for other body areas.

As a result, sellers must prioritizeIPL devicesoffering a sizable amount of intensity. That way, consumers can easily treat their body, face, and other areas with stubborn hair without suffering the effects of using the wrong intensity.

Treatment modes

Consumers need different treatment modes to handle body hair quickly and facial hair precisely. For this reason, someIPL devicesoffer stamping modes, while others feature gliding techniques (usually divided into thumb-press or thumb-free gliding modes).

Note: It’s recommended that businesses opt for models offering both treatment modes.

Final words

IPL beauty devices have revolutionized the way consumers deal with unwanted hair. Moreover, consumers will only reap the full benefits if these devices come in kits.

For the best experience, users will need a safety razor for shaving, an IPL device for destroying hair follicles, and UV-protective glasses to keep their eyes safe. Although consumers can get them separately, businesses will offer more value if they come in a single kit.

Combined with the factors discussed in this article, retailers are sure to get a higher ROI in 2024.

Take Mothers to Start a Skincare Journey: All-in-one Set

An all-in-one skincare set is an excellent gift idea for Mother’s Day. Mothers worldwide often neglect their self-care as they dedicate so much energy to looking after their families. A set that includes a cleanser, toner, moisturizer, serum, and eye cream can offer a rejuvenating journey for mothers weary from the day’s demands. This thoughtful gift provides a convenient and simplified routine, allowing mothers to indulge in some much-needed pampering without the hassle of juggling multiple products.

Appealing to the trend of doing more with less, curated minimalist skincare, haircare, and makeup sets offer new beauty moments. Whether she’s a ‘Lazy’ Skinimalist, a Skintentional consumer, or someone just beginning to explore the world of beauty and self-care, a carefully curated set can cater to her specific needs and preferences. This personalized touch not only shows your appreciation for all that she does but also your attention to her individual needs, making it a truly meaningful gift.

Scents of Nostalgia: Perfuming Memories for Mother’s Day

Expanding the range to include bath, body, haircare, and home fragrances allows for a more comprehensive sensory experience. Products that incorporate heritage and indigenous ingredients celebrate local traditions and cultures, offering a narrative of generational beauty rituals and lifestyles. This approach to Mother’s Day gifting not only enriches the emotional value of the gift but also pays homage to the rich tapestry of global cultures, making it a deeply meaningful and memorable gesture.

By focusing on fragrances that offer a journey through scent, retailers can provide their customers with a unique and touching way to express their love and appreciation on Mother’s Day, making each gift a tribute to the shared memories and bonds between mothers and their children.

Miniature Luxuries: The Perfect Bite-Sized Indulgences for Mother’s Day

Retailers have a golden opportunity to stock up on deluxe mini collections of premium bestsellers, offering consumers the chance to gift their loved ones with a taste of luxury at a fraction of the price. This Mother’s Day, miniature luxuries stand out as a thoughtful and practical gift option. They offer the perfect blend of luxury and functionality, allowing mothers to explore and enjoy premium products in a way that’s both accessible and sustainable.

In addition, brands like France-based Mustela and Danish brand SoKind, which focus on creating natural and allergy-certified products for mothers and babies, set the standard for family-friendly gifting. Products like these, which offer long-lasting appeal through bulk and jumbo-sized packaging, provide value and ensure the well-being of all family members. This Mother’s Day, embracing family-friendly gifting means offering products that simplify life, ensure safety, and bring joy to every family member.

Conclusion:

As Mother’s Day approaches, retailers have a unique opportunity to cater to the diverse needs and preferences of consumers looking to celebrate the special women in their lives. By offering a curated selection of all-in-one skincare sets, nostalgic fragrances, miniature luxuries, and family-friendly products, businesses can provide thoughtful and meaningful gift options that resonate with customers. Embracing trends such as skinimalism and focusing on personalization and sustainability can further enhance the appeal of your offerings. Sun Protection Meets Skincare Innovation

Suncare is undergoing a transformative shift towards a skincare-centric approach that’s captivating daily sunscreen users. These innovative formulations not only shield your skin from harmful UV rays but also deliver a wealth of skincare advantages. This transformative movement towards multifunctional suncare products represents a groundbreaking shift in the beauty industry, where protection, benefits, and aesthetics converge to meet the evolving demands of the modern skincare enthusiast.”

Multifunctional: Sun Protection and Beauty Enhancement

Combining sun protection with cosmetic benefits has gained significant momentum in recent years! Microbiome Harmony: The New Frontier in SPF Technology

In 2024, the suncare industry takes a giant leap with SPF products focusing on the skin microbiome. Recognizing the crucial role of the skin’s natural flora, these products are designed to protect and nourish the microbiome while offering robust sun protection.

According to research conducted by the Swiss ingredient supplier DSM-Firmenich, exposure to the sun can negatively affect the skin’s microbiome. UV filters, which safeguard the skin and beneficial bacteria from harmful UV rays, such as those found in Vytrus Biotech’s Photobiome from Spain, are becoming increasingly popular.

Suncare products aimed at enhancing the skin’s microbiome are incorporating prebiotics, postbiotics, and ferments to strengthen the skin’s protective barrier. The French brand SeventyOne Percent’s Feel Free SPF30 DD Cream is a skincare treatment that includes prebiotics in addition to UV filters.

The hands are particularly susceptible to sun damage due to their constant exposure to UV rays. In the post-pandemic era, interest in hand care has gained prominence. This trend indicates a shift in consumer awareness and industry response, recognizing that comprehensive sun protection is integral to overall skin health and beauty.

As the beauty industry continues to evolve, our quest for holistic sun protection and radiant skin remains unwavering. From microbiome-friendly SPF innovations to specialized solutions for every inch of our bodies, the suncare landscape has never been more promising. In this ever-changing world of beauty, one thing remains constant: comprehensive sun protection is not just a shield against UV rays; it’s a vital component of our journey towards healthier, more beautiful skin. Embrace the future of suncare, where innovation meets protection, and where the sun’s glow becomes a reflection of your radiant, cared-for skin.

title: Anti-Wrinkle Devices: 5 Trends to Leverage for the Perfect Treatment - Alibaba.com Reads Keywords: Beauty, Beauty Equipment, Home Use Beauty Equipment, New Arrivals, Trend Analysis

Everyone shows signs of aging eventually. Wrinkles start forming, and skin becomes saggy—mostly because the body stops producing enough collagen to keep the youthful look.

But when consumers don’t like the aging look, what can they do? Well, businesses can offer them specialized devices that help rejuvenate the skin, making the signs, like wrinkles, less visible.

Explore this article to discover five anti-wrinkle device trends with amazing effects consumers will love.

Table of ContentsOverview of the global anti-wrinkle device market5 top-trending devices to help consumers fight aging and wrinklesRounding up

Overview of the global anti-wrinkle device market

In 2022, experts valued the global anti-wrinkle device market at US $10.96 billion. They also expect it to experience continuous growth at an 8.9% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) from 2023 to 2030.

The increasing awareness about age-related skin problems, like fine lines, wrinkles, and skin dullness, is the market’s major growth driver. Consumers are more likely to spend on devices that sustain youthful appearances, which experts also say will boost market growth.

Asia-Pacific dominated the market in 2022, by contributing 36.10% of the total revenue share. North America was also one of the major regional markets for anti-aging devices in 2022 due to better living conditions, high per capita income, and easy product availability.

5 top-trending devices to help consumers fight aging and wrinkles

1. Microcurrent devices

Traditional beauty products likeserumsand creams have long been mainstays, but new trends are rising to take over the at-home skincare tool scene—and one of them ismicrocurrent devices.

These devices are gaining popularity, as users say consistent use results in firmer and more defined skin. But what are these devices?Microcurrent beauty toolsuse low-voltage electrical currents to stimulate the facial muscles. This procedure may help the user’s face look tighter and reduce visible aging signs.

The best part is that consumers can getmicrocurrent devicesto use at home. They are special handheld devices that won’t shoot up the user’s electricity bill. Alternatively, businesses can offer more powerful models to dermatologists or estheticians.

Microcurrent devicesmay not have any scientific research to support their claims, but they’ve been getting much attention in 2023. According to Google Ads data, branded variants like “Foreo Bear” and “Nuface Mini” average 40,500 and 33,100 searches monthly.

The generic variants are also holding their own, search-wise. In November 2023, they garnered 12,100 searches, proving consumers are actively looking for these devices.

2. LED light therapy devices

LED therapyharnesses different light wavelengths for skincare treatments. They discovered its significant potential for skin care applications initially developed by NASA to stimulate plant growth.

Now, various aestheticians useLED light therapy devicesto help revitalize the skin, reducing the signs of aging. Usually, these devices use red or blue light to treat skincare concerns—blue is for acne treatment, while red works for anti-aging.

Compared to other types of light therapy, LEDs don’t create ultraviolet rays, meaning they’re safe for regular use. These devices won’t cause burns like other anti-aging treatments like chemical peels, laser therapy, and dermabrasion.

Consumers shouldn’t worry if they can’t make frequent trips to aestheticians—they can still enjoy LED light therapy at home. Devices businesses can offer include LED wands and masks that users can apply on their faces for several minutes at a time.

LED light therapy maskshave witnessed significant growth in 2023. In October, they garnered 90,500 searches—impressive, but nothing compared to their 135,000 searches in November 2023! That’s a 60% boost in one month!

LED wands may not be as popular as their mask counterparts, but they’ve also seen some growth. They jumped from 8,100 in September to 9,900 in November 2023.

3. Radiofrequency (RF) devices

Radiofrequency (RF) devicesprovide skin-tightening effects to help smoothen skin. They generate enough heat to kickstart the facial skin’s collagen, elastin, and new cell production.

What’s great about these devices is that they are a non-surgical way to get facelifting effects for sagging skin. Although they offer temporary benefits, consumers won’t be able to differentiate between performing surgery and using these devices.

While the heat may worry some consumers, these devices are one of the safest ways to fight aging effects. They use safe low-frequency electromagnetic waves to generate the heat that enters the user’s skin layers—no safety hazards here.

Speaking of safety,RF deviceshave very slim chances of causing hyperpigmentation. However, it’s ideal for younger consumers with fresh signs of aging and won’t work for severely wrinkled or saggy skin.

RF technology can also be combined with other devices to offer better anti-wrinkle treatments. For instance, consumers can use radiofrequency microneedling to target early signs of aging. Another type combines LED light therapy withRFto create devices that help promote collagen production.

RF microneedling is one of the more popular types, with a consistent 49,500 monthly searches throughout 2023. Regular radiofrequency devices only get 8,100 searches, but it’s still impressive.

4. Ultrasound devices

Regarding nourishing, anti-aging facial treatments, ultrasound facial therapies are top. These devices use high-level sound (or ultrasonic) waves to stimulate the skin, penetrating deep below the surface.

In addition to smoothing wrinkles, thesefacial therapy devicespromote cellular renewal/repair, increase blood circulation, combat puffiness, improve blood circulation, and encourage lymphatic drainage.

Basically, retailers can invest in two types of ultrasonic skin care devices: hand-held and table-top. Hand-held models are more popular for home use because of their user-friendliness and lack of need for professional assistance.

On the other hand, table-top ultrasound beauty devices offer stronger results but need professional hands to be effective. Also, they often come with additional features, like facial massagers and steamers. Table-top ultrasound devices are more common in esthetician offices with dedicated treatment rooms.

5. Microneedling devices

Microneedling deviceshelp address various skin concerns. Unlike other light- or sound-based devices, this method makes physical contact with small, sterile needles, puncturing the skin and inducing controlled physical trauma.

The good news is that it’s not as bad as it sounds. This process pushes the dermis (a deeper skin layer) to start rebuilding, allowing it to produce more collagen to keep the skin youthful.Microneedling devicescan help address many anti-aging concerns, including wrinkles and saggy skin.

However, results from microneedling are not immediate. It may take several months for consumers to see results since the process involves new skin growth. Regardless, microneedling is an effective and safe way to treat wrinkles and rejuvenate the skin.

Microneedlingis the most popular anti-wrinkle solution on this list. These devices average 550,000 searches monthly, and it has been consistent since July 2023.

Rounding up

The anti-aging landscape constantly evolves, introducing exciting tools businesses can capitalize on in 2024. Microcurrent devices are ideal for consumers who don’t mind a little shock, whileLED light therapyis the safest way to deal with wrinkles.

RF devices offer a hotter alternative, and ultrasonic offers a more alternative. Lastly, microneedling is the most popular procedure for restoring youthfulness to aging faces.

So don’t hesitate! The market is booming, making it the perfect time to enter the anti-wrinkle industry in 2024!

What are eyebrow extension kits?

Eyebrow extension kitsideally come equipped with everything a novice or expert would need to preen their natural brows. Eyebrow extensions involve attaching natural hairs or synthetic fibers to existing eyebrows via adhesives to make them look fuller – and kits make such a task much easier.

Eyebrow extensionsare particularly attractive because they’re an easier and more affordable way to buff natural brows.

5 products consumers look for in eyebrow extension kits

Eyebrow extension glues

Eyebrow extension gluesare key to achieving a great natural brow look. These specially designed adhesives help stick individual synthetic hairs to the user’s natural brows, creating a fuller, bolder, and more defined look.

Typically,eyebrow extension gluescome in liquid or gel form and are designed to provide a strong and lasting bond. They usually contain hypoallergenic and gentle ingredients to reduce the risk of adverse reactions and irritations, making them safe for use on delicate skin and around the eyes.

Beginner-friendly browextension gluestend to be more forgiving, drying slower so that novices can correct any errors. The only downside is that they don’t last as long as more advanced glues – consumers can expect their lashes to last two weeks maximum.

In comparison, professional-grade brow extension glues are where things get serious. They offer fast-drying formulas that leave no room for mistakes, lasting up to two months.

Eyebrow fiber extensions

Noeyebrow extension kitis complete without eyebrow fiber extensions. These small synthetic hairs – usually made from nylon or polyester – mimic natural eyebrows, and come in different colors to match various eyebrow shades.

Eyebrow fibersare a fast and non-invasive alternative to traditional methods like microblading or permanent makeup, letting users customize their eyebrow shape and style without long-term commitment. Plus, they can be easily removed at the end of the day.

Consumers looking for natural-looking results are likely to chooseeyebrow fibersthat match their brow color. Others looking for more brow definition may prefer.

Synthetic fibersmay be the most versatile and affordable option for eyebrow extensions but aren’t the most natural appearing. Consumers looking for the most natural look and feel may opt for silk or human hair fibers. However, these are more expensive than synthetic variants, and less colorful.

Tweezers

Tweezersprovide users with the precision they need to pluck fine, individual hairs.

While specializedtweezersfor eyebrow extensions don’t really exist, varieties designed for lash extensions work perfectly well. Typically, they have longer handles than regular tweezers to help with removing stray hairs, as well as sharp, thinner tips for picking up fiddly extensions.

One of the most populartweezerchoices for eyebrow extensions is those with slanted tips. These tips give users a clear view of what they’re doing, allowing precise placement and removal of individual brow extensions.

Isolationtweezersare also great for eyebrow extensions, featuring angled tips but with a slight bend that helps to isolate individual brow fibers for easier application and removal.

Straighttweezersare also great for beginners, providing improved impressive grip and control.

Eyebrow extension gels

What if consumers don’t want the hassle of applying each hair? They can usebrow extension gels, whose mixed, gel-like formula means brow extensions can be easily applied directly to their brows.

Eyebrow extension gelsare a fairly new product in the world of eyebrow extensions, allowing for easy manipulation of brow thickness and definition enhancements.

These gels come in two main types: fiber-infused gels and gel-based formulas. Fiber-infused gels contain tiny fibers that adhere to existing brow hairs, filling in gaps and creating a fuller appearance.

These fibers can be made from nylon, synthetic hair, or even cellulose, and come in various shades and thicknesses to match the user’s natural brows. They’re also easy to use, offer quick results, and last several hours, making them great for consumers with sparse or patchy brows.

In comparison,gel-based formulasdon’t contain any fibers. Instead, they use thickening and defining formulas to make existing brow hairs appear fluffier and more voluminous. Some varieties may also have tinting properties to help add color and definition.

Gel-based formulastend to be more natural-looking than fiber-infused variants. Plus, they work well with all brow types and are compatible with many other brow products.

Brow brushes

Eyebrow brushesare designed specifically for grooming and shaping eyebrows. These brushes come in various shapes and sizes, each serving a different purpose in achieving well-defined and polished eyebrows.

Our journey through the vibrant and innovative world of sun care has revealed a dynamic industry at the forefront of beauty and skincare. Eyelashes can make or break any makeup look. If they look gorgeous, the entire face would feel the effect—if they don’t, the look may as well be a wasted effort. However, crafting the perfect eyelashes requires having the right tools, which creates opportunities for businesses to make profits by making the right offers.

But here’s the catch: there are so many tools to choose from, making it harder to select the right ones. Fortunately, this article will dive into five outstanding trends that makeup artists (beginners and experts) need in their lash arsenal.

Table of ContentsOverview of the global eyelash tools market5 trendy eyelash extension tools to stock in 2024In conclusion

Overview of the global eyelash tools market

Eyelash tools are a segment in theglobal makeup tool market, which experts valued at US $2.617 billion in 2021. Reports also suggest the market will cross US $6 billion by 2031, growing at an 8.7% compound annual growth rate (CAGR).

Eyelash tools emerge as one of the largest segments. Experts also predict that the popularity of do-it-yourself sessions will help boost market growth.

North America dominates the makeup tools market. However, Asia-Pacific will witness outstanding growth due to the change in customer tendencies, the rising number of people, growing globalization, and the extension of optional capital.

5 trendy eyelash extension tools to stock in 2024

1. Tweezer sets

Eyelash tweezersare made to help with the little details of lash artistry. These tools are indispensable, as lash artists need them to apply eyelash extensions from start to finish.

Although various tweezer types currently flood the market, beginners need only three for lash applications: straight, isolation, and curved (or L-shaped) tweezers.

Straight tweezers are the basic ones everyone should have. They can pick up eyelash extensions with ease. Further, their designs ensure consumers have the firmest grip on their lash extensions.

On the other hand, isolation tweezers are necessary for keeping the natural lashes away from extensions. They have slightly curved undersides, making it easy to get perfect isolation—no clumpy, unattractive lashes!

Curved tweezers are the go-to for creating eye-catching volume eyelash looks. With these tweezers, ladies can easily control the lash fan volume, resulting in effortless and great finishing.

Other tweezers that may come in a moreprofessional setinclude pointed straight, pointed curve, pointed edge, volume, and round volume lash tweezers.

Sincetweezersare a must-have tool, it’s no surprise they also do well search-wise. Google Ads data shows that these lash tools attracted 246,000 searches in November 2023—a 20% increase from September’s 201,000 inquiries.

2. Lash adhesives

Lash adhesivesare also very important for eyelash extensions. Since eyelash extensions are synthetic, they need something to bond them to the natural lashes without any side effects. That’s why consumers can’t just use any adhesives they want.

Regular adhesives contain ingredients that may lead to lash loss. Even worse, consumers may have serious allergies or suffer from eye damage.

Thankfully, manufacturers make lash glues with various ingredients that will get the job done without causing any harm. For instance, cyanoacrylates are a main adhesive ingredient inlash glues, as they are highly compatible with human skin, hair, and other organic tissues.

In addition, lash artists can choose between two adhesive varieties, depending on their skill level: slow-drying and fast-drying lash glues. Here’s a brief look at both options:

Lash adhesives also gained increased attention in 2023. While not as popular as tweezers, they’ve grown from 40,500 in October to 49,500 in November 2023.

3. Gel pads & lash tape

Different things can happen while applying lash extensions. The lower lashes could get in the way, or the client’s skin may get irritated, leading to a less-than-ideal experience. Well,gel padsand lash tapes can fix that.

Gel pads help shield the lower lashes, preventing them from gluing to the upper ones. As a result, lash artists can avoid causing their clients discomfort or damaging their lashes. They also create a barrier between the skin around the eyes and lash adhesives, reducing potential irritation and redness.

Conversely, lash tape simply secures the natural lashes and extensions in place. They’re adhesive strips that some lash technicians use instead of gel pads. However, usinglash tapesalone can be uncomfortable for clients, especially when removing lashes after application.

But when combined, these tools provide an even better experience. While the gel pad creates a more soothing and relaxing experience, lash tapes help to secure rogue lashes that escape from under the pads.

According to Google Ads, gel pads get a consistent 14,800 monthly searches, while lash tapes get 3,600.

4. Eyelash brushes

Whether consumers rock natural lashes or extensions, they’ll need eyelash brushes to comb and fluff them regularly. These tools help remove buildup (dirt, makeup, or skin cells), helping extensions last longer and improving their appearance.

Eyelash brushesalso help during the application process. Consumers can use these tools to ensure everything stays well-adhered and separated. Further, they are great for securing stray lashes and checking if the extension needs more adhesives.

If consumers don’t want the hassle of cleaning standard eyelash brushes, they can get disposable ones. They’re more convenient and can come in 100 pieces or more bundles.

Eyelash brushes’performance may be low, but they’re still gaining enough attention to be profitable. In November 2023, they averaged 9,900 searches, showing thousands of potential customers are searching for eyelash brushes.

5. Lash adhesive remover

Eventually, consumers will have to remove their lash extensions. When that time comes, all they need to make the process easier arelash adhesive removers.

Gel removers are the most popular types available. Consumers can use them to remove partial or entire eyelash extension sets. However, cream removers are the safer way to remove lash extensions.

Unlike gels, cream removers can detach the entire eyelash extension set in one application. Plus, their thick, cream-like consistency is easy to apply and will sit on the client’s lashes without spilling into the eyes or skin.

Lash adhesive removersheld significant search interest in 2023. In October and November, they got 14,800 searches.

In conclusion

Becoming an experienced lash artist isn’t a walk in the park. It requires the right tools and a lot of practice for consumers to become the pros many clients need.

Businesses can equip their target customers with the right equipment by investing in tweezer sets, lash adhesives, gel pads/lash tapes, eyelash brushes, and lash adhesive removers.

They can offer them in sets or sell them individually—both ways will surely turn in profits in 2024.

Facial mask materials: The top 5 to sell in 2024

Cotton facial masks

Cottonis one of the most common materials for facial masks. Such masks are hypoallergenic, meaning they won’t irritate the skin. And they can hold a good amount of serum when consumers wear them for their beauty routines.

Cotton facial masksare also very soft. In addition to fitting well on the face, they’re incredibly breathable, allowing air and moisture to move freely. That way, the skin will stay moisturized and comfortable while the sheet mask is on.

Speaking more on their hypoallergenic properties,cotton facial maskshave a soothing effect on the skin, making them ideal for calming irritated or inflamed skin. These masks can also help reduce redness while providing a cooling sensation.

Some cotton facial masks even come with gentle exfoliating agents that help remove dead skin cells and promote cell turnover. The results? A smoother, brighter, and more youthful complexion. The best part is cotton is generally more affordable than other materials, making it the go-to for daily masks.

Hydrogel facial mask

When Genic graced the world with the firsthydrogel maskin 2009, it flipped the beauty scene over its head. Everyone was clamoring for one, pushing companies to make even more hydro gel masks to meet the demand. Although the craze has since died down, hydrogel remains one of the best materials for facial sheet masks.

Whilehydrogelis not a natural material, manufacturers combine natural polymers, including water, glycerin, and hydrocolloids, to make the material. This combination gives it the famous gel-like structure that gives the skin deep hydration and nourishment.

Typically,hydrogel masksare highly absorbent (way more than cotton). So they can soak up all the serum, preventing it from running down or evaporating easily. Their porous nature also ensures they effectively deliver active ingredients to the skin.

Speaking of active ingredients,hydrogel masksare often infused with hyaluronic acid, aloe vera, green tea extracts, and Vitamin C/E. These ingredients help them improve the appearance of fine lines/wrinkles, reduce inflammation, and brighten complexion.

Tencel facial mask

With the world shifting toward eco-friendly practices, materials likeTenceleasily grab the spotlight. Tencel is a sustainable synthetic fiber obtained from trees. It’s popular for its softness and hypoallergenic nature, making it even suitable for baby clothing.

What’s more,Tencel facial maskshave excellent skin compatibility and high air permeability. All kinds of consumers will feel extremely comfortable when using them for their daily beauty routine.

Even better,Tencel facial masksoffer impressive cooling and calming effects, making them particularly beneficial for consumers with sensitive or irritated skin. Why is this material eco-friendly? Well, Tencel face masks are biodegradable and compostable, making them a great option for consumers hoping to reduce their environmental impact.

But wait, there’s more!Tencel fibersalso have a high moisture absorption capacity, allowing them to hold up to 20 times their weight in water. For this reason, they’re ideal for vitalizing dry or exhausted skin.

Biocellulose mask

Biocellulose masksare on the premium side of facial masks. Manufacturers synthesize them from 100% natural fibers, with each strand being 1000 times thinner than human hair! For this reason, biocellulose masks easily deliver maximum results to every inch of the skin.

These masks also have the best moisture retention.Biocellulose maskscan hold serums (or water) up to 100 times their weight, making them an excellent material for dry skin. The thin fibers are simply better at attracting and retaining moisture.

Biocellulose masksalso adhere to the skin tightly. They have an excellent fit so consumers can focus on their daily tasks without worrying about the masks slipping or sliding. These tiny fibers are also eco-friendly, allowing users to enjoy premium products while reducing their environmental impact.

Charcoal masks

Nowadays, one can find activated charcoal in almost every beauty product, from cleansers to soaps. However, they offer special properties when used infacial masks, which is one of the reasons why consumers love them.

Charcoal masksare quite different from other facial masks. Instead of washing or peeling off easily, they cling to the skin, helping to pull out blackheads, hair, dead skin, and other pore-clogging criminals. Charcoal masks are also the best options for detoxifying the skin’s surface.

However,these masksare not the best for consumers with sensitive skin or certain conditions. Sometimes, they can cause excessive skin peeling, resulting in very painful experiences or permanent skin damage.

Regardless, active charcoal’s ability to absorb toxins and bacteria from the skin makes it one of the best ingredients for face masks.

Rounding up

Facial masks didn’t start as an essential beauty product. Some people saw them as uncomfortable due to their non-woven fabric history, and consumers had to lie down to use them effectively. However, the market changed after 2009 saw the first hydrogel mask hit the shelves.

Now, a huge chunk of people love facial masks due to the material variety—they’re also starting the year with 110000 searches (based on Google Ads). The five top ones to grab in 2024 include cotton, hydrogel, Tencel, biocellulose, and charcoal facial masks.

The key design feature here is the ability of the packaging to serve as a canvas for personal expression, enabling brands to engage with consumers on a more intimate level.

title: Derma Rollers: Why They Are Trending & How to Profit From Them in 2024 - Alibaba.com Reads Keywords: Aesthetic Medicine, Beauty, Derma Rolling System, New Arrivals, Trend Analysis

Dermarolling, also known as micro-needling, has captured the attention of many skincare enthusiasts. This technique boasts various benefits, including plumping lips, tightening the skin, and reducing puffiness under the eyes.

Although consumers can visit a medical spa to get this treatment, they can also use dermarollersat home to get similar effects. This article will explore why derma rollers dominate the skincare world and how retailers can leverage that popularity in 2024.

Table of ContentsWhy are derma rollers popular?Overview of the global derma roller marketDo derma rollers help stimulate hair growth?4 factors to consider before investing in derma rollersRounding up

Why are derma rollers popular?

Derma rollershave hundreds of tiny needles that create microscopic holes in the user’s skin. Although it sounds concerning, these holes are so small that they’re invisible to the human eye and are not painful.

Nevertheless, these devices are so popular because the micro-injuries they cause can kickstart elastin and collagen production. The results? A plumper and tighter complexion, with no wrinkles or puffiness to be seen.

Overview of the global derma roller market

According to reports, theglobal derma roller marketreached US $328 million in 2022, with predictions to hit US $560 million by the end of 2030, registering a 7% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) over the forecast period.

The market owes its expansion to the rising demand for skin care tools among beauty-conscious customers, who are mostly middle-aged women within the young baby boomers and Generation X. The surge in demand for these tools among middle-aged women and those with rising disposable income is also boosting market growth.

Specialty stores captured a huge chunk of the global derma rollers market in 2024, and experts predict it will continue holding the largest share over the forecast period. Asia-Pacific also emerged as the largest regional market, while North America follows behind as the fastest-growing region.

Do derma rollers help stimulate hair growth?

Derma rollerscan stimulate growth in the same way they help rejuvenate the skin. These devices puncture the scalp with tiny needles, pushing it to create more collagen/elastin and circulate blood to the hair follicles.

Moreso, these devices are ideal for improving nutrient delivery and tropical treatment effectiveness. The microscopic holes serve as channels, creating an easy way for serums and oils to penetrate deeply into the skin. For this reason, many see derma rollers as remarkable, non-invasive hair loss treatment options.

4 factors to consider before investing in derma rollers

1. Choose the right needle length

Derma rollersoffer different needle lengths, ranging from 0.2 to 3.0 mm. Moreover, choosing the best needle length mostly depends on the target consumer’s goals. Here’s a table showing the different needle lengths and why users may need them.

2. Consider the consumer’s skin condition

Various skin conditions can push consumers towardderma rollers. But the thing is, the skin condition they’re hoping to fix also determines the needle length they’ll need. So, businesses must understand their target audience’s needs before offering these tools.

Here’s a look at the common skin conditions that derma rollers can help fix:

For treating scars and acne,derma rollersare highly effective. They accelerate the skin’s repair processes, increasing the likelihood of scar healing without leaving permanent marks.

The recommended needle length for acne scars is 0.75 to 1 mm, while deeper scars may require 1.5 mm. Larger-sized rollers (1.5 mm and above) are suggested for treating scars on areas other than the face.

With a 0.5-mm-lengthderma roller, consumers can address wrinkles and fine lines. They effectively enhance skin elasticity, helping to conceal wrinkles and prevent discoloration.

Derma rollers(especially ones with 0.5 mm and below needle lengths) effectively reduce hyperpigmentation, breaking up the melanin clusters causing the issue. These sizes will also enhance skin-lightening cream absorption, helping to quicken results.

Stretch marks are deeper than regular scars, meaning they’ll need bigger needles (1.5 mm to 2.0 mm) for a fix. These rollers can increase the skin’s derma layer thickness, slowly eliminating the marks and smoothing the area.

Consumers who want to fix hair loss issues need 0.5- to 1.0-mm rollers. These rollers can easily stimulate the scalp enough to boost hair growth.

Dermarolling is the go-to treatment for combating enlarged pores, as it stimulates collagen production. This process tightens and plumps up enlarged pores, effectively reducing their size. However, consumers won’t need any more than 0.5 mm rollers to correct enlarged pores.

3. Prioritize high-quality materials

Manufacturers equip theirderma rollerswith tiny needles made from stainless steel or titanium. Although both materials are incredible, most consumers prefer titanium needles for their longevity and durability.

And, if consumers want stainless steel needles, prioritize derma rollers with medical-grade ones for the best experience.

4. Factor in how often consumers will use them

Eachmicroneedlesize requires a different use frequency. Generally, smaller needles mean consumers can use dermarolling more often, while the opposite happens for larger ones.

Rounding up

Undoubtedly,derma rollershave become one of the most popular skincare tools in 2023. In truth, they garnered 450,000 searches in November alone, proving how widespread the device is in the beauty market.

Whether it’s smoothing fine lines, encouraging hair growth, pushing serums into the skin, or minimizing scar visibility, derma rollers can do it all.

However, the derma roller’s size determines how quick the results will be. Smaller models (0.20 to 1.0 mm) won’t cause bleeding and will offer mostly painless procedures. However, bigger ones (1.5 mm and higher) may cause bleeding but provide faster results.

Remember these tips when purchasing derma rollers to curate the best skin care offers in 2024.

Understanding regional preferences is crucial for ultra-luxe brands to resonate with global audiences. The ultra-luxe market presents a significant opportunity for brands willing to push the boundaries of luxury. EMS sculpting machinestarget electromagnetic energy on muscle areas, pushing them to contract at 100% capacity and keeping them in that state for six seconds. Such feats are impossible with regular exercises, as the average person can only contract their muscles at 35% capacity.

The result of these contractions is the muscle adapting and reconstructing itself, eliminating the fat cells in the target area and creating a better build. In addition, the process doesn’t cause pain or discomfort—clients will only feel a pulling sensation. Effectiveness and technology

Note: HIFEM-RF EMS machines are not as effective as their non-combo counterparts. While they have the added benefit of tighter, smoother skin for faces, they won’t help for other muscle areas.

Safety features

Like every other unit,EMS sculpting machinesmust have the necessary safety features to prevent accidents. Things can easily go sideways if EMS units don’t have features like automatic shut-off and overcurrent protection.

Automatic shut-off ensures theEMS machinesstop after a certain period. It helps prevent excessive muscle stimulation, reduces the fatigue and discomfort risk, and promotes responsible usage.

Overcurrent protection is crucial as it helps monitor and control the electrical currents transmitted to the muscles. This safety feature acts as a safeguard, keeping things safe in the event of a surge that could lead to injury.

Portability and design

These considerations are more relevant for sellers targeting at-home users. Bigger, salon-gradeEMS machinesdon’t need to be moved around often, so they don’t need portability.

However, those planning to use EMS devices at home or take them to different locations will prefer compact and lightweight designs. Additionally, the machine should also be easy to store.

Final words

Mesotherapy: What is this beauty procedure?

Introduced by Dr. Michel Pistor in 1952, mesotherapy is an effective rejuvenating technique that injects a cocktail of vitamins, antioxidants, enzymes, and plant extracts through microneedles. This technique works on the middle layer of the skin, making it similar to acupuncture.

Depending on the injection technique, one can choose between three types of mesotherapy: point-by-point, upper skin, and comprehensive mesotherapy. Some technicians also classify mesotherapy based on application area—which means that one can get hair mesotherapy, body mesotherapy, and mesolifting.

Mesolipo is another form of mesotherapy that targets body fat. Although less potent than surgical liposuction, mesolipo uses natural, active fat-reduction ingredients to stimulate fat metabolism.

While mesotherapy procedures typically involve needles, not everyone can handle the little punctures. For this reason, needle-free mesotherapy became a huge hit, as technicians use ultrasonic machines to inject drug mixtures into the middle skin layer without microneedles.

But how does this happen? The ultrasonic machine pushes the cell membrane from a semi-permeable state into a fully permeable one for a short time, allowing the skin to absorb the liquid treatment.

Although needle-free mesotherapy has less successful results than their needle variants, it’s still an amazing alternative for people sensitive to needles.

The human skin is fascinating, capable of shedding dead cells every 28 to 30 days to make way for new ones. However, some cases may see these dead cells overstay their welcome, resulting in consumers having flaky skin and an uneven texture.

While that sounds like something out of a horror movie for beauty-focused individuals, it has an easy solution: exfoliation. Facial scrubs are one of the most popular (and effective) exfoliators available today.

But with this immense popularity comes a scary variety that makes it tricky to choose the best ones for target consumers. Luckily, this article will shed some light on what businesses must look for when selecting facial scrubs in 2024.

Is now a good time to enter the facial scrub market?

According to reports, theglobal facial scrubmarket had a US $1.7 billion value in 2022. However, marketing experts project the market will touch US $2.8 billion by 2031, growing at a 5.2% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) over the forecast period.

The market is booming due to rising awareness of the importance of skincare, the increasing popularity of natural and organic products, and the growing prevalence of DIY beauty.

North America is the largest facial scrub market, followed by Europe, Asia-Pacific, Latin America, the Middle East, and Africa. The increasing awareness of skincare benefits also drives the regional market’s growth.

3 factors to consider when purchasing facial scrubs

1. Mode of action (type)

Exfoliation is simple. All it does is give the skin a nudge to shed skin cells faster and more efficiently. But unlike other physical exfoliants,face scrubscombine abrasion and chemical ingredients to provide the best results.

The physical side offace scrubshelps smooth the skin instantly by focusing on the visible skin layers. They often contain abrasive materials, like ground apricots, sand, and silicone microbeads, that require interaction and friction to rid the skin of flakiness or uneven texture.

On the other hand, the chemical side targets the deeper layers of the skin while consumers scrub. These ingredients add antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, and collagen-boosting benefits to face scrubs, allowing them to accommodate different skin types.

However, if target consumers want more of the scrubbing action, businesses can stock up on more physical-focused face scrubs. While consumers who focus more on ingredients in their beauty products will gravitate toward scrubs that combine physical and chemical exfoliants.

2. Consumer’s skin type

The consumer’s skin type is the most important aspect when stocking up on facial scrubs. Although manufacturers don’t labelfacial scrubsaccording to skin compatibility, some are more appropriate for certain skin types. For instance, consumers with sensitive skin can’t use the same face scrubs as those with oily skin.

Dry skin needs water-soluble ingredients, while oily skin prefers oil-soluble ingredients in beauty products. Someface scrubstarget aging signs and acne effectively, too. So, knowing the target consumer’s skin type can help sellers pick the right scrub for them.

3. Product’s concentration

Like coffee, everyface scrubhas strength. Consumers with sensitive skin prefer mild scrubs, while those with more tolerant skin prefer stronger exfoliants. Remember that face scrubs combine physical and chemical exfoliants, meaning they have concentration levels for each side.

The type of exfoliant used in scrubs determines their physical contraction. For instance, perfectly round jojoba beads are mild, while exfoliants like crushed pumice, sand, and sugar are strong.

Facial scrubchemical concentration is more straightforward. The more chemical percentages the formula has, the stronger the effects.

Face scrubs with a 2% salicylic acid concentration can help balance oil production and work with other ingredients (like charcoal and Kaolin clay) to help combat acne-prone skin.

Do consumers need other products with facial scrubs?

Facial scrubs make the skin more sensitive than usual. Since they use physical abrasion, scrubbing can leave the skin with less moisture and make it more susceptible to environmental irritants like UV rays.

That’s why consumers will need other products with their face scrubs. They’ll need cleansers to remove any remaining dirt, toners to restore the skin’s pH balance (and remove residual exfoliators), serums to provide nutrients and antioxidants, and moisturizers to hydrate and protect the skin.

The best part is that this opens more opportunities for businesses to create value on special occasions or gifting seasons. All these products can make an irresistible exfoliation set and even be the perfect way to ease beginners into beauty regimens.

Final words

Skincare is exploding in 2024! Even men are now sticking to some kind of beauty routine to keep their skin looking fresh and great (but women still dominate the market!). Facial scrubs are integral to these beauty regimens, as many consumers prefer using them for exfoliation.

The numbers don’t lie! Facial scrubs started in 2024, with 201,000 people searching for them (based on Google Ads). However, selling these products needs much consideration to avoid selling the wrong product and making consumers angry.

So, before jumping into the face scrub market, consider the product’s mode of action, ingredient concentration, and target consumer’sskin type. It’ll help point toward the perfect scrubs for more sales in 2024.

Understanding the concept of red light therapy

Red light therapy is an emerging non-invasive cosmetic treatment that utilizes low-wavelength red light to enhance the user’s skin appearance. It helps to reduce acne, scars, wrinkles, redness, and other medical conditions.

Initially, NASA explored red light therapy for promoting plant growth in space and helping to heal astronaut-related wounds. But like other advancements, research expanded into exploring additional potential applications, like skin care.

The idea behind red light therapy is to impact mitochondria, often called the “powerhouse” within the body’s cells. Providing more energy enables other cells to function more effectively, including repairing skin, promoting new cell growth, and enhancing skin rejuvenation.

In other words, red light therapy allows specific cells to absorb the light wavelengths, stimulating them to perform their functions. Remember that no evidence supports RLT’s effectiveness, but it’s been gaining enough attention to warrant multiple beauty devices flooding the market.

5 factors to consider when choosing red light therapy machines

1. Red, near-infrared, or combo?

Usually, businesses can choose between three types ofred light therapy machines: red light, near-infrared light, and a combination of both. Some people often mistake them for the same thing, but these light types differ despite their similarities.

For instance, infrared light is not visible to the human eye. Instead, users will feel heat on their skin, with longer wavelengths penetrating deep into the cells. Conversely, red light is visible because it has shorter wavelengths.

Also, red light can’t get deeply into the skin, so most consumers use it to treat the skin’s surface. For this reason,red light unitsare the go-to for combating surface issues like acne, wound healing, sunburns, yeast infections, and hair loss.

Since near-infrared light can penetrate three times deeper than red light, it extends these benefits to the muscles, joints, and bones. So, such units are perfect for consumers searching for something more intense than surface skin issues.

However, if consumers want skin surface and deeper tissue treatments but only want one device, businesses can offer themcombo units—manufacturers design them to meet a wider range of requirements.

2. Optimal wavelength

Remember that science measures light in nanometers (nm) based on wavelength. Typically, red light falls between 600 and 700 nm, which is visible and bright. On the other hand, infrared or near-infrared light falls in the 700–900 nm range, which isn’t visible to the naked eye.

Studies indicate that light wavelengths between 660 and 670 nm and 830 and 850 nm significantly impact cellular respiration while offering the highest light absorption level.

Opting forred light therapy machinesthat can deliver these optimal wavelength ranges will offer consumers maximum benefits for their skin health.

3. Light intensity & irradiance

These two factors work hand-in-hand to ensurered light machinesoffer maximum effectiveness. Light irradiance represents the unit’s power density, signifying the quantity of energy reaching the user’s skin. This measurement is expressed in milliwatts per square centimeter (mW/cm2), indicating the amount of photons flowing through an area and absorbable by the cells.

While irradiance is important,  it would mean nothing without the right intensity. A low-powered unit won’t be able to generate sufficient red light energy for the necessary irradiance, meaning consumers won’t get the maximum benefit.

As we embrace 2024, the fragrance world is witnessing a remarkable shift, marked by a striking statistic: a staggering 93% of global consumers now demand higher-quality, more potent scents. This surge in preference for full-bodied, enduring fragrances is not just a fleeting trend but a defining movement in the global fragrance market.

In 2023 the iconic ‘Savage Elixir’ by Dior, a reinvention of the already popular Sauvage, is leading the charge, epitomizing the global shift towards fragrances that are not only intense but also richly composed. TikTok’s Fragrance Revolution: Gen Z’s Quest for Bold, Status-Defining Scents

According to a recent study in 2015, by Allen, Havlíček & Roberts, a full-bodied, notable scent can significantly enhance and highlight an individual’s unique personality. Under the influence of TikTok, Gen Z & younger Millennials are on the hunt for stronger scents, with fragrance emerging as a new symbol of status. Gen Z is the most potential consumer keen on distinguishing themselves from the norm, gravitating towards bold fragrances that establish a strong scent identity.

Research shows consumers are willing to pay more for fragrances that last longer and use higher-quality ingredients. This trend towards more concentrated fragrances is likely driven by inflation, leading consumers to seek more value and luxury in their purchases. These luxury variants are not only popular among consumers but also offer a more financially sustainable option for brands compared to constant new product development.

Second, offer unique and bold scents that appeal to Gen Z’s love for distinctive, niche fragrances. Will the makeup kit market remain profitable in the future?

What products should be inside a makeup kit?

Face primer

Consumers can’t use facial makeup effectively withoutprimers. These products help create a smooth and even base for other makeup products, making their application easy.

Beyond laying the foundation, face primers also increase the makeup’s longevity, ensuring consumers’ different beauty products layered on top don’t smudge, budge, or fade away throughout the day.

Foundation

This productalso creates a flawless makeup base for other products. Usually, consumers use foundations after primers to achieve a controlled matte finish.

However, the foundation type they’ll need in a kit depends on their skin type (oily, dry skin, or both) and experience. For instance, liquid foundation is the best for beginners and consumers with dry skin, whilepressed variantsare perfect for those with oily skin.

Powder foundations offer the best of both worlds. Consumers can use them wet or dry, as the foundation’s texture will become creamy and soft when needed.

Concealer

On some days, consumers may need to cover blemishes and under eye circles—or give their complexion a helping hand. That’s whereconcealerscome in.

They’ll help cover up those pesky spots with a few wipes, making users look good as new. However, beauty experts recommend choosinglightweight formulasthat won’t feel thick or greasy on the user’s skin.

Setting powder

After applying various products, consumers must blend everything to avoid standing out like a disco ball.Setting powderwill help do just that.

Beginners shift toward addingpressed powderto their makeup kits because they are easy to use. Although loose powders excel at creating blurred, airbrushed looks, they can get messy if used incorrectly—so leave them for the professional kits.

Blush

Blushesare the only way consumers can add color to their face—especially after getting the signature flat and boring look from applying base makeup products.

Applyingblushesto the cheeks’ apples will give users a natural-looking flush, helping also to enhance complexion. Blush palettes are the best options for consumers to try different shades and mix-and-match colors.

Contour

Users who want depth and dimension on their faces will need contours.These productshelp create shadows and carve out facial features.

Contour sticksare a beginner’s best friend as they offer more control over how much product they apply to their face.

Highlighter

Highlightersare the perfect products to add to any makeup kit, beginner or not. These products can help consumers transfer their makeup game, whether they love glam or subtle looks.

Kajal

While eyeliners are great, not everyone can pull off an amazing look with them. In such cases, users can swap them with theclassic kajal.

Regardless of skill level,kajalswill help consumers define their eyes and upgrade their eye makeup game.

Lipstick

However, beginners may struggle to choose theright lipstick shade, formula, and texture. So, as a rule of thumb, makeup kits should come with at least two lip products—creamy matte lipstick (bullet format) for everyday use and bold liquid variants for fancy events.

Setting spray

Setting spraysare necessary for a makeup kit, as they help consumers secure their facial creations till the end of the day. Using a makeup setting spray after applying everything locks in the look for as long as consumers want it.
